label: 汗衫
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The outermost robe worn on formal occasions by young girls in the service of Imperial consorts.  The distinguishing feature of the kazami was its long separate panels, which trailed gracefully onto the floor.  The sleeves were turned back at the wrists to show the garments underneath (p. 264n).
